head.supplied: 25/4/89. ¶ ¶ Being engaged for Saturday noon, dear Mr MacDonald, I have thanked the Directors of the Evening-Standard for their invitation, and stated to them, that I had transferred the ticket to ¶...

div.p: A38 Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Victorian Branch) papers, letter book, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

Being engaged for Saturday noon, dear Mr MacDonald, I have thanked the Directors of the Evening-Standard for their invitation, and stated to them, that I had transferred the ticket to you as the executive Representative of the R.G.S.A. of Austral.
Royal Geographical Society of Australasia. here. As you are now arranging the accounts, will you kindly send my £10— also to the Hon. Dr Campbell in Adelaide, as a contribution of mine, (which was overlooked previously,) towards the fund of Tietkens' Expedition. I have great hopes for his success. I have written to the Under-Secretary fully about the desirability of £1000 again being placed on the estimates of 1889-1890, so that we may have fund again for the season 1890.
Letter not found. I will follow this up by a personal interview. Within the next days I shall write a letter, (similarly to the last) as a sort of Duplicate
as a sort of Duplicate is a marginal addition, its intended position indicated by an asterisk. to the Rev. Mr Lawes, our Representative in NG,
New Guinea. No such letter has been found. urging that the Rev Mr Chalmers ascends the Owen Stanley's Ranges in 1889 yet. I am very busy , so much so in the Department, that I had to work all the Easter-holidays through
